Description.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $3.641 million to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

The LCS Mine Countermeasures (MCM) Mission Package (MP) counters bottom, tethered, near surface, and surface mines in the littorals without putting Sailors in the minefield. When the MCM MP is embarked, LCS is capable of conducting detect-to-engage operations (hunting, sweeping, and neutralization) against shallow and deep-water sea mine threats. The MCM MP provides these capabilities through the use of sensors and weapons deployed from an embarked MH-60S multi-mission helicopter and unmanned off-board vehicles. The embarked MH-60S employs the Organic Airborne Mine Countermeasures systems to provide rapid mine hunting. 

Organic Airborne Mine Countermeasures (OAMCM) systems provide the long-range, airborne capability to conduct minehunting and clearing operations in littoral zones, confined straits, choke points, and the Amphibious Objective Area (AOA) quickly.

The Coastal Mine Reconnaissance Module will detect mines in the surface zone and beach zone areas, providing the Joint Force Commander with the information needed to clear mines with non-LCS assets and allow military forces to safely and effectively storm the beaches.  This procurement line supports the LCS mine countermeasures mission package, providing deployable combat capability to the LCS MCM squadron. 

The Airborne Mine Neutralization Module (MH-60S Helo + Airborne Mine Neutralization System) and Near Surface Detection (NSD) Module (MH-60S Helo + Airborne Mine Laser Detection System) achieved Initial Operational Capability (IOC) in Q1 FY 2017.  Following IOC of the COBRA system in July of 2017, the Coastal Mine Reconnaissance (CMR) Module (MQ-8 VTUAV + COBRA + MP equipment) will achieve IOC in Q3 FY 2018.

The program will add future capabilities to provide a surface influence sweep capability via the Unmanned Minesweeping (UMS) Module: Unmanned Influence Sweeping System (UISS) (MCM Unmanned Surface Vehicle (USV) + Unmanned Surface Sweep System) for high-speed influence minesweeping,  Remote Minehunting Module (MCM USV + AN/AQS-20 Minehunting Sonar) to detect bottom and tethered mines and the Buried Minehunting Module (Knifefish Unmanned Underwater Vehicle) to detect buried mines and mines in a high clutter environment.   When complete, the MCM MP will provide full capability against floating, tethered, bottom, and buried mines.

The MCM MP is deployable and capable of meeting its focused mission requirements on an LCS only when it includes the full complement of Common Mission Modules Equipment (Line Item Number 1600) and the full complement of mission systems that comprise each MCM Module (Line Item Number 1601). If all mission systems are not procured in any given Fiscal Year, the program will provide partial MCM capabilities to the Fleet to deploy until the mission systems are replaced in a subsequent Fiscal Year.

Other Related Budgets: BLIs: OPN 1600, OPN 1602, OPN 1603, OPN 4248, OPN 2622, OPN 2624, WPN 4221, WPN 4225, RDT&E 0603596N

Justification.val: FY 2019 funding includes the procurement of one Unmanned Influence Sweeping System (UISS), two Mine Countermeasures (MCM) Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USV), two Knifefish systems, two UISS MH D&Rs, two Airborne Mine Neutralizing Systems (AMNS), one COBRA and associated support equipment.  All MCM assets procured in FY19 support MCM Mission Package deployments starting in FY21 and build MCM capacity required to minimize the service life extension for the MH-53E helicopters and MCM-1 ship. The increase in FY 2019 from FY2018 is attributed to the initial procurement of the Buried Minehunting Module (two Knifefish systems and ancillary equipment) as well as the Remote Minehunting Module (two MCM USVs and two UISS MH D&Rs).

Remarks.val:
[Hardware] MC001- The Unmanned Minesweeping Module provides an unmanned surface, long endurance bottom sweep capability to clear large areas of mines that may remain after mine-hunting operations are complete.

[Hardware] The Buried Minehunting Module provides capability to detect and identify buried mines and mines in a cluttered ocean bottom environment.  This procurement line supports the LCS mine countermeasures mission package, providing deployable combat capability to the LCS MCM squadron.

[Hardware] MC006 - MCM SUPPORT EQUIPMENT]: Support equipment related to the individual modules.

[Hardware] The Remote Minehunting module is comprised of an MCM USV + Minehunting Deploy and Retrieve (MH D&R) Rig coupled with two (2) AN/AQS-20C minehunting sonars.  This module provides a rapid minehunting capability for volume and bottom mines, and also a bottom mine identification capability. The unit cost of the MCM USV includes the cost of one (1) craft, one (1) MH D&R Rig, and one (1) support cradle.

[Support Cost] MC900 - Provides program management support, engineering and technical support, studies, analysis and evaluation on mission module systems.

Name.@footnote: 1.1.1) The Unmanned Influence Sweep System consists of a USV and a sweep payload.

Name.val: MC003 - ORGANIC AIRBORNE MINE COUNTERMEASURES (OAMCM) SYSTEMS

Name.@footnote: ALMDS unit prices are based on economic order quantity / step-ladder pricing in existing contract.  FY17 and FY18 unit price based on 1 production unit each year.

2.1.4) AMNS Tech Refreshes improve reliability and maintainability to previously procured AMNS units and correct deficiencies that allow the equipment to perform in accordance with current deployment configuration / operational requirements.
Name.val: 2.1.3) AMNS Technology Refresh and Obsolescence Upgrades
2.1.4) ALMDS Technology Refresh and obsolescence Upgrades

Name.@footnote: FY17 - FY20 reflects Economic Order Quantity (EOQ) when taking into consideration the COBRA training assets procured through OPN 2624 where COBRA systems are procured to provide initial and proficiency training to Navy aircrews.
Knifefish pricing is based on the EDM/LRIP contract and reflects procurement of two (2) Unmanned Underwater Vehicles (UUV).

The unit cost includes all necessary equipment to outfit the Buried Minehunting (BMH) Module to include the base pallet, launch and recovery device, shipping containers, support equipment (Deck tie down case, ballast transport case, grapple assembly, winch case, and other tools), and the BMH Specialized Container.

7.1.1) The MCM USV contains one (1) USV craft and one (1) Minehunting Deploy and Retrieve (D&R) Rig for deploying and retrieving the AN/AQS-20 minehunting sonar.  The USV craft is based on the vehicle/craft in the UISS system.  An MCM USV baseline will be developed based on the UISS craft by FY19 to be compatible for both minehunting and minesweeping missions.

7.1.2) The UISS Minehunting Deploy and Retrieve Rig includes the Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) to the UISS craft to allow the vehicle to perform minehunting missions and also the deploy and retrieve handling system for the AN/AQS-20 minehunting sonar.
The AQS-20C is a towed variable depth minehunting sonar.
